news.title: New math and quantum mechanics: Fluid mechanics suggests alternative to quantum orthodoxy
news.summary: The central mystery of quantum mechanics is that small chunks of matter sometimes seem to behave like particles, sometimes like waves. For most of the past century, the prevailing explanation of this conundrum has been what's called the "Copenhagen interpr

news.title: Fluid mechanics suggests alternative to quantum orthodoxy
news.summary: New math explains dynamics of fluid systems that mimic many peculiarities of quantum mechanics.

news.title: Focus: Surface Waves Store Bouncing Droplet’s History
news.summary: August 26, 2016• Physics 9, 101 A droplet bouncing and wandering across a liquid surface can produce waves that store the history of its chaotic motion.

blogs.title: Pilot Wave Hydrodynamics
blogs.summary: In a new article for the Annual Review of Fluid Mechanics, John Bush of MIT reviews experimental evidence showing fluid droplets exhibiting quantum-esque features. In particular, walking droplets are being touted as an analog system to investigate quantum

wikipedia.title: Double-slit experiment
wikipedia.summary: Other atomic-scale entities such as electrons are found to exhibit the same behavior when fired toward a double slit.

wikipedia.title: Stochastic electrodynamics
wikipedia.summary: Given the posited emergent nature of quantum laws in SED, it has been argued that this "quantum equilibrium" has an analogous status to that of thermal equilibrium in classical dynamics.

wikipedia.title: De Broglie–Bohm theory
wikipedia.summary: The de Broglie–Bohm theory, also known as the pilot-wave theory, Bohmian mechanics, the Bohm or Bohm's interpretation, and the causal interpretation, is an interpretation of quantum theory.

wikipedia.title: De Broglie–Bohm theory
wikipedia.summary: The de Broglie–Bohm theory, also known as the pilot-wave theory, Bohmian mechanics, the Bohm or Bohm's interpretation, and the causal interpretation, is an interpretation of quantum theory.

wikipedia.title: Quantum vacuum thruster
wikipedia.summary: A quantum vacuum plasma thruster (or Q-thruster) is a proposed type of spacecraft thruster that would work in part by acting on the virtual particles produced by quantum vacuum fluctuations.
